title: Which drum tracks are the best in the history of rock music? - Quora

response.answer_text: I would have to say : “You could be mine” by Guns and Roses on their Use Your Illusion II Cd. The drums, Superbly played by Matt Sorum, are super punchy and just stand out of the mix great. (The engineer who got the “Drum Sound” at the studio that day should be proud, and should have got a percent of the royalties as well.) I often use this track to test or set up stereos as I know just how it should sound. and it sounds GREAT! Another would just HAVE to be Crazy B*tch, by Buck Cherry. The bass drum sounds SLAMMIN, and I could probably just listen to it by itself…….(Not ) If the rest of the song didn’t rock so good that is. it sounds to me , But don’t quote me on it , cause I ain’t said Sh*t , that it is a bigger bass drum , like a 24″ or even 26″ maybe a Ludwig or even Pearl, with a thick single ply head on the batter side (Where you KICK it!) tuned just tight enough to take the wrinkles out of it, and either no head on the other side and a big feather pillow stuffed in it, or another head on it and it is tuned just a little tighter than the batter side, so it doesn’t ring, but gives a little push back when laid into. And my guess would be maybe a sennheiser MD 421 mic on it pulled out into the room a little so your catching the first low frequency coming off the drum. One of the best Bass drum sounds caught on tape, So good you can almost describe it while listening to it………..Uh see above. And another would have to be Megadeth’s song “Trust” off of Cryptic Writings…….Hell just listen to the whole CD of “Countdown to Extinction” if and you’ re wanting “Some Drums” you are. Okay, So I got to stop writing before I bore somebody….Again.
